name: 360smartcleaner
0:
”Alexa, turn on mycleaner.”
”Alexa, turn off mycleaner.”
”Alexa, set the power level on mycleaner to quiet.”
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
des:
Qihoo 360 has been developing in the field of a smart home for many years and has released a variety of products. The 360 Robot Vacuum Cleaners are highly intelligent robots that utilize high-precision radar and many other sensors, all working together through advanced algorithms to create and follow sophisticated, accurate maps and plans. Vacuuming and mopping are all in one, providing daily efficient full indoor cleanings without human assistance. 

The Skill supports 360 Robot Vacuum Cleaners. You can turn on/off the cleaner or set up the power level by voice command via Alexa.

Connection steps:
1. Please download the "360Robot" App first.
2. Register and log in to the "360Robot" App. Follow the user manual in the box and instructions on your App to bind your Robot to your App account.
3. Log in to the "Alexa" App, choose "Devices - YOUR SMART HOME SKILLS - ENABLE SMART HOME SKILLS" and search for the skill named "360 smart cleaner". Enable the skill and log in to your "360Robot" account. After these two accounts are linked, click "DISCOVER DEVICES" and wait until your Robot is found. Then set up your device on Alexa App.

When using the skill, you need established names for your devices. There are two ways to define these names:
a. Use the names you previously set up. They are shown in the "360Robot" App and can be changed;
b. Create an Alexa group, like Bedroom or Downstairs, and add the device to the group.

Once you know the name or group name for your devices, you can say the following:
"Alexa, turn on mycleaner."
"Alexa, turn off mycleaner."
"Alexa, set the power level on mycleaner to quiet."

The Skill content is in English, Spanish, German, French, Italian, Portuguese, Japanese, and Hindi.
